What is JFFC?

Continuing the legacy of teaching web design to students

Junior Form Function & Class (JFFC) is an annual 2-day event and is Asiaâ€™s premiere student web design conference providing opportunities and learning experiences which help students develop their design skills further.

JFFC derives from Form Function & Class (FFC), an annual event by the Philippine Web Designers Organization (PWDO), with the goal of uplifting the state of web design in the country.

Breaking the limits of students beyond their boundaries in Web Design

From being future-forward comes this year's Junior Form Function & Class 2020 -- the event of the new decade for the youth to "break through boundaries" in Web Design and achieve more beyond their learning horizons.

This year, JFFC is organised by the User Experience Society - DLSU with the support of the Philippine Web Designers Organization.

Our Speakers

2020's Boundary Breakers

JFFC 2020's speakers will be announced soon. In the meantime, you may check our Facebook Page to see last year's Future Forward Web Enablers.

Frequently Asked Questions

What do you need to know?

Is this event for students only?

YES. Junior Form Function & Class is only for students. For industry professionals, there is FFC organised by the Philippine Web Designers Organization. JFFC is organized by User Experience Society - DLSU with support from the Philippine Web Designers Organization.

How can I pay for my tickets?

You can buy your tickets using PayPal/Credit/Debit Cards through Eventbrite and using Cash (PHP) through our Campus Ambassadors.

Where can I find Campus Ambassadors?

Campus Ambassadors will be announced soon!

We are still in talks with different school orgs to identify potential Campus Ambassadors. If you are interested in becoming a Campus Ambassador, send us an e-mail.

Are tickets refundable?

All ticket sales are considered final. However, tickets are transferable provided that the person you will transfer the ticket to is also a student.
Please send us an email at jffcasia@pwdo.org with the name, contact details, and the school of the person you wish to transfer the ticket to, along with reference number of the Eventbrite transaction.

Got a question beyond our FAQs? Contact us at jffcasia@pwdo.org
